CONJUGATES: plural: mothers | verb forms: mothers, mothering, mothered
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English mōdor, from Proto-Germanic *mōdēr, ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *méh₂tēr.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A female parent of a child or animal; a woman who has given birth to or raised a child.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 孩子的女性父母；生育或抚养孩子的女性。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My mother always supported my decisions.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我妈妈总是支持我的决定。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The origin or source of something, or a person or thing that creates or develops something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某事物的起源或来源，或创造或发展某事物的人或物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Necessity is the mother of invention.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word naming an attribute of a noun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relating to, or characteristic of, a mother; maternal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 与母亲相关的，或具有母亲特征的；母性的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb (a verb that requires one or more objects).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To care for or protect someone with great affection, as a mother would.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 像母亲般地悉心照料或保护某人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She tended to mother her younger siblings.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她倾向于像母亲一样照顾她的弟弟妹妹。
